s.text: But we do trust Scott, a former naval-intelligence officer and editor of the Washington Monthly . Though if the typos get any worse, we may need to e-mail him a supply of Seattle's favorite beverage.
But we do trust Scott, a former naval-intelligence officer and editor of the Washington Monthly . Though if the typos get any worse, we may need to e-mail him a supply of Seattle's favorite beverage.
But we do trust Scott, a former naval-intelligence officer and editor of the Washington Monthly . Though if the typos get any worse, we may need to e-mail him a supply of Seattle's favorite beverage.
The author of this feature, Scott Shuger, lives in Los Angeles.
These readers ask: Don't you edit this thing?
Meanwhile, it is every journalist's fantasy to be able to mainline prose directly into a publication without the interference of an editor.
